1.23.23  1:44 pm   good afternoon
can keyboard maestro run php script?
i've got this simple little thing here:
<?php
$password= substr(str_shuffle("0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"),0,15);
echo $password
?>
which spits out a nice kinda-random string for me so i can name things wildly and then just sort by date instead of what i was doing previously , which was naming by date and then limiting byself by then being unable to sort by non-date

anyway do you either know if php scripts will run in KM somehow, or do you know of a good alternative scripting language where i can do this same thing?

thanks so much in advance ifyou answer this

      there's a 'run shell script' action that will let you do php for sure. but the way i do random strings is like this

1.23.23  1:08 pm   do you like mindfucks, and getting mindfucked?

      every now and again

1.23.23  10:27 am   how do i force myself to stop noodling around in the text editor and actually write a god DAMN NOVEL

      if you've never done it before, try to write something much much shorter. something that's done in 1 sentence. that will get you accustomed to the responsibility of carrying something from beginning to end. it's like eating a goat. you gotta eat small goats first

1.23.23  8:30 am   Can you drop a hint about the next video that's about to come out?

      sure. it gets into choreo

1.23.23  7:56 am   why is now always now?

     because now is what now means. it means itself

      why can't it be back then, or in the future?

     because those other things also mean themselves

      how about using an unstoppable force

1.23.23  2:36 am   has it been your experience that listing out all the possibilities you can do helps you figure out what possibilities you haven't tried?

     yes

     like the periodic table, the scientist who invented it found gaps in the table where elements should be, and was able to predict what those elements would be like.

     that reminds me of when i was building my weekly schedule in late january 2014. i figured out that at least one of the obvious categories had barely been covered yet

1.23.23  2:25 am   how do you think clouds taste like?

      air, or if you condensed it enough, water

      some of the time it is, some of the time it's not. the mood swings up and down on a moment to moment basis

1.22.23  10:45 pm   Some things are so good that they hurt. Not like physical pain, but they are so good that they make me feel sort of bad in a twisted way. Do you know what I'm talking about?

     there are so many things that might fit this description

      Is there a way to fix this?

     in many cases i think yes

     Or does the bad feeling actually make it even more good, and so it's actually worth it to not fix it. 

     i guess you're gonna have to decide how much you like or don't like the feeling

1.22.23  9:38 pm   do you like men

      i like all kinds of people. sometimes i don't even notice a person's gender, especially if they are fully clothed

1.22.23  9:35 pm   i have to have a well thought out question, right?

      no

1.22.23  9:26 pm   Somehow I have a legitimate question. I'm lead tenor sax at my high school jazz band, and so I get to solo fairly often. I'd say that I can solo very well, but I usually don't have the confidence to get up and actually do it. Do you have any suggestions on what I should do?

      you say you get to solo very often, and yet you say you usually don't have the confidence to do it. So i'm not sure if you're saying you do it often, or you don't do it often. But, in any case, if you don't do it often, my absolute best suggestion would be to do it more often and you'll have more and more confidence each time. And, if you do do it often, and you say you do it very well, then in that case it sounds like everything is going pretty great

1.22.23  9:15 pm   Will you ever release you music on a vinyl records??
Bpleeeease?? Prettie please?? 

      that's not really in my wheel house

1.22.23  9:01 pm   how old are you in feelings

      must be in the billions

1.22.23  8:20 pm   What should I do first? 

      first, make a list of all the things you could do first

1.22.23  8:13 pm   what the hell is the college application process

      i have no earthly idea

1.22.23  8:02 pm   how do you know when the thing you're working on is finished

      gotta just decide

1.22.23  7:11 pm   I heard a song in a dream last night, and it was great (I think). The issue is that I didn't wake up immediately, so by the time I woke up I could only recall vague ideas of what I think it went like, and it felt very underwhelming compared to what it felt like in my dream. Has this happened to you?

     yes

     I'd love a bulletproof way to always wake up immediately after hearing a song, but not so soon that it doesn't have time to finish (which has also happened to me), but I'm not sure if that's possible

     they're hard to catch. the more time you spend writing and coming up with things while you're awake, the easier it will be to remember and understand what you hear in your dreams. and it will also generally increase the chances that the good stuff will also come around while you're awake

1.22.23  7:00 pm   how do i force myself to stop noodling around in the daw and actually make a god DAMN SONG

      try this: write the song somewhere else. then you will be nimble enough to imagine how the song goes, overall, without being plagued with all the exact details of how to build it. you will be free, to imagine it going any way you want. focus on what *happens*. how it will be perceived. see what you're capable of imagining, and see if you can find a writing system that allows you to explain that on the page. Then once you know how the song goes, then hit the studio and then you'll be on a mission

1.22.23  6:04 pm   Is "The Ground Plane" about self limitations and how even if you can't do what others do, you can still achieve your goals exactly how you are? That's how I interpreted it but I may be crazy

      that's a good way to interpret it

1.22.23  12:28 pm   What do you believe human nature is?

     couldn't possibly describe it. you'd have to get to know a human and see first hand what their nature is

     Do you think it trends good or evil?

      it's a little hard to get an objective answer there, because the humans themselves are the ones keeping score

1.22.23  11:24 am   why should anything happen?

      to find out what else happens as a result

1.22.23  10:39 am   what's your ideal level of realism for your 3d settings?

     just want the emotion. if i wanted realism then i'd probably start using cameras, actors, etc

      surely if you were able to somehow perfectly recreate the real world you'd have to draw  the line somewhere. does this question even matter or is it kind of automatically taken care of for the time being by time restraints?

      with most things it's actually better to not go too close to realism. with humans, and especially human faces, it's REALLY REALLY important not to get very close to realism. i've done multiple experiments with even something as simple as just adding noses to my characters, and i found that even just that makes them more creepy and less relatable

1.22.23  10:05 am   do you ever sleep

      yes i do. i was asleep when you asked this

      yes and no, simultaneously
